caption: Beautiful doesnt even describe this place. A peaceful stunning experience. Hawkers bugging you half way up, when you get past them its relaxing and calm. Gift shops in this area the cheapest we found and you can do deals with them.

Awesome  The church is sooo pretty (and has free audio explanation)  The garden is huge and the carrousel looks so cute next to them  The view from there is awesome  I recommend you to go at 9 that is open and are less people

Nice place to visit, John Wick: The Fourth Estate was filmed here, so I think it will be a great experience for visitors to discover the place, as every place there has a story connected to the movie.

This is a nice urban park situated upon the sloping hillside that leads to Basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur in Montmartre. There is a lovely staircase leading up its sides to the basilica, including stretches of open grassy areas to just take a seat and enjoy the views of the city. You will also find an embedded wall around halfway up the the sloping park with three marine themed fountains. At the base there is also a late 19th-century carousel that adds to the charm of the square.  A few benches as well as nice landscaping and flowerbeds can be found at the sides of the square as you walk upward as well. It is a nice free-park location in Paris, worth spending a few extra minutes if you are planning to visit Sacre-Coeur.

Square Louise Michel is a charming and peaceful park nestled right at the base of Sacr√©-C≈ìur in Montmartre. It offers a perfect place to rest and enjoy the stunning panoramic views of Paris after walking up the hill. The greenery and pathways are well-maintained, and it‚Äôs a beautiful spot to relax, take pictures, or have a picnic. The atmosphere is lively with street musicians adding to the vibe, making it a memorable experience. Be prepared for some crowds, especially on sunny days!  ---

Square Louise Michel, located at 12 Place St-Pierre, 75018 Paris, France, is the highest point in Paris and home to the most beautiful church. The view from the church is breathtaking, both the exterior and the stunning interior of the cathedral. The atmosphere is serene and captivating. However, I‚Äôm unsure about the belief surrounding the padlocks. Make sure to visit this place with the right mindset. Highly recommended for its beauty and unique charm

Square Louise Michel is a charming park located at the foot of the Sacr√©-C≈ìur Basilica in Montmartre, Paris. The terraced gardens offer a peaceful escape with lush greenery, colorful flowers, and winding paths leading up to the iconic basilica. As you climb the steps through the square, you‚Äôre rewarded with stunning views of Paris, making it a popular spot for both tourists and locals to relax and enjoy the scenery. Whether you‚Äôre resting on a bench or taking in the sweeping city views, Square Louise Michel is a lovely place to unwind in one of Paris‚Äôs most picturesque neighborhoods.
Wonderfully peaceful area after the hustle and bustle of the crowds before and after the tour of the Basilica.

A wonderful place to sit and enjoy the vibes and views. You can grab food from many of the restaurants near by and sit with a friend and have an amazing time. There is a carousel and a playground for kids. Would highly recommend if in the area
A very wonderful church with an amazing architecture recommended to celebrate Sunday mass there

The Square Louise Michel holds a lovely garden and is at the foot of Basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur in Montmatre and offers spectacular views of the City of Paris.  After spending some time here and taking in the views, you can either walk down the steps or take the funicular down. The steps are a bit steep but not difficult at all to walk down.  It was fairly crowded even in March, it can be windy or breezy at times but the breathtaking views from here is well worth it.
It's such a beautiful site. I'm very happy that I had an opportunity to see it in person.
Never mind summer these areas are getting packed, doesn't seem to matter what time of year, that said still worth a visit, such a majestic area.

Square Louise Michel offers a breathtaking view from the top of Paris. Despite being a bit crowded and windy, the presence of a charming wine shop adds to the experience. Ascending the stairs might be a tad tiring, but the option to pay for the electric stairs is truly amazing, making the journey even more memorable.

Beautiful place! You can enjoy a panoramic view of the entire city. However, it tends to get quite crowded, which can make it challenging to capture a perfect picture. Additionally, reaching this spot requires climbing several stairs. As I always say, when visiting Paris, it's essential to wear comfortable shoes.

I took a tram to the top where I got to enjoy the most beautiful views of Paris. There are a lot people enjoying the sights and sounds. There also where some people trying to get you to sign something and collect money they were very aggressive and there were a lot of them. Other that that the chapel was also breath taking too.
Beware of pickpockets! Otherwise a lovely place to relax and pass time

Such a breath taking building!  The town that sounds the Basilique Du Sacre-Coeur is such a chraming town with lots of shops and caf√©s.  There are lot‚Äôs of tourist so keep track of your belongings. Scams are also popular in this area so keep an eye out for people trying to sell you things.  If you go to the right of the stairs up to the monument there is a red and cream house. This house is called the ‚Äòsinking house‚Äô. Definitely stop to take a picture, you have to turn you phone upside down to get the right angle.  Definitely recommend checking tho s place out!

Beautiful park with some of the best views in Paris. There is a trolly that can take you up and down the hill to the church at the top. If you are planning on having a picnic here, keep in mind it may be difficult due to the incline.

Square Louise Michel - Despite its small size, It offers some stunning views of the city. From the top of the hill, visitors can see the rooftops of Paris, including the iconic Montmartre neighborhood. The park is home to a small sculpture garden featuring works by local artists. Visitors can admire the art while enjoying the peaceful atmosphere of the park. Square Louise Michel is one of the few parks in Paris that has an outdoor gym, complete with exercise equipment that visitors can use for free. This is a great way to stay active while enjoying the park. it is a relatively unknown park, Square Louise Michel is often less crowded than other popular parks in Paris. This makes it a great spot for visitors who want to get away from the crowds and enjoy a quiet, peaceful oasis in the heart of the city.

Be prepared to do a lot of walking up the stairs...but for those who are unable to, they do have a little lift that can bring you up there. Beautiful building. Very crowded. Well know tourist attractions. The nice thing about it is free to enter.
One of the most beautiful places in Paris

Definitely a must-see stop in Paris. Beware of the people that try to put bracelets on you though! Pickpockets are very active there and the bracelet guys can get a bit aggressive. It is very beautiful and the little shops at the top of the hill are a bit more expensive but the setting is worth it.

Square Louise Michel in Paris offers an unforgettable experience with its captivating panoramic views of the city. From this hidden gem, visitors can marvel at the iconic landmarks and charming streets that make Paris truly magical.  While it can get crowded at times, the view from Square Louise Michel is worth the wait. Be prepared to find the perfect spot for capturing breathtaking photographs amidst the occasional crowd. Don't forget to wear comfortable shoes and take your time exploring this enchanting location.

A beautiful place to spend some time with your family and friends. This place is very crowded in summer so be advised.  You have a lot of other places around and also a cafe and restaurant nearby for you to have a delightful afternoon or morning.
A wonderful place with a wonderful view just will have to go up a few stairs if you can't there's teleferique

Pick a time when crowds likely to be less. Lots of walking to explore the area. Carousel helps keep kids engaged. Food outlets expensive... very few options for vegetarians... can check out vegan place called SweetRawmance, diagonally opposite the carousel. Quaint art gallery nearby, serving affordable coffee and bites.
What can be said, other than iconic!
The green surroundings are heart touching. Beautiful place to visit for mindfulness but be aware of black africans there who trap you and then demand money.

Pretty square with a mesmerizing carousel!  There is also a kid‚Äôs playground! You can take tram up or get dropped off by car on top. Be aware of some people who try to ask you to wear their bracelet and ask you for money, a bit scary.  Good view of the city at peak. Tons of people, don‚Äôt get lost lol.

If harrasment by scam artists or the constant spectre of losing your wallet, in between braving lots of stairs is exciting and exhilarating to you then this is a must see for any visit to Paris.  Enjoy the tour de force of the Bracelet scam (particularly effective in terrorising young women), Shell Game (everyone but you is in on it) or ‚ÄúPlease take my survey‚Äù - where you roll the dice on having your pocket picked or being duped into giving money to fake charity (or both if you are lucky).  Your reward is a beautiful view of Paris - best to take an alternative route to the top.
Beautiful park/square with many people sitting on the slopes enjoying the magnificent view of Paris. If you'll visit during sunset get ready to search for a spot because the place will be backed.

Nice view from the top, it is very nice garden with stairs to Sacre-coeur. Stairs are not so steep. You will not find a ramp to push baby stroller  around the stairs.Lots of love locks. It seems love birds are putting locks all over the paris. You could also find some people selling the locks around this place.

Nearest metro line 2. You can see the beautiful view of Paris City. Nice place to view the Paris in one minute :p . Religious people pray their. Some of the people go their for traveling, you can go and enjoy the beauty of nature.

Because the transportation was down while visiting this was the furthest location we visited by foot. From the Eiffel Tower it is about 1.5 hours walking and around 4 miles (6 KM). It is located north of Galerie Lafayette and as you pass it you‚Äôll begin to notice the remaining walk will have an incline. As you approach the base from the street you‚Äôll see plenty of open space leading up the stairs to the top along with a small carousel near the street. There is no cost to go in but there are donation boxes throughout the basilica if you prefer to leave some money. The hill upon which the basilica was built has been a religious site for centuries in France. The basilica itself has only been around for almost 200 years and contains a crypt underneath the ground level. As you pass the security to enter the basilica you‚Äôll see the stairs that go down into the crypt. It is fairly elaborate and contains various artifacts along with information on the basilica and the history of it. All together it will take about 1-2 hours to see everything so it can be fit in during other daily activities. Nearby you can also find a popular colorful staircase leading up the back end of the basilica which many people also photograph while here. You can also stop by the Moulin Rouge which is less than a mile from here. Although it is a bit of a walk if the train isn‚Äôt working, it's worth stopping by to see especially now that Notre Dame is under construction. - @wanderingwithustwo
Like visiting a village within a city. Beautiful basilica and the surrounding. Nice night view too.
Panoramic view, plato...everything üëâüèª ‚Ä¶
It is an amazing building with a beautiful view. You can also take a coffee and enjoy it there.
